name: Braised Lamb Shanks with Garlic and Rosemary

ingredients.name: kosher
ingredients.original_string: 2 teaspoons kosher or coarse sea salt

ingredients.name: to 6 pounds lamb shanks
ingredients.original_string: 5 to 6 pounds lamb shanks, not trimmed of fat

ingredients.name: large
ingredients.original_string: 1 large, firm head garlic (about 15 cloves), separated into cloves, each crushed and peeled (see Note)

ingredients.name: medium yellow onions
ingredients.original_string: 2 medium yellow onions, peeled and coarsely chopped

ingredients.name: large carrot
ingredients.original_string: 1 large carrot, peeled and cut in 1/4-inch slices

ingredients.name: finely grated zest of 1 large lemon
ingredients.original_string: Finely grated zest of 1 large lemon

ingredients.name: heaping tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh rosemary leaves
ingredients.original_string: 2 heaping tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh rosemary leaves

instructions: In a small bowl mix the red wine, mustard, salt, and pepper and place in the insert of the slow cooker. Layer the shanks in the insert so they fit. Scatter the remaining ingredients around and on the shanks. Cover and cook on HIGH for 6 hours. Use tongs to reverse the position of the shanks, top to bottom. Reduce the setting to LOW and cook for an additional 6 hours.
Use a slotted spoon to transfer the shanks to a serving platter. Skim the fat from the cooking juices, taste, and add salt and pepper, if needed. Pour the juices over the shanks, and serve.
For a less assertive garlic taste, use elephant garlic.
